metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5141 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability in the notifications Push API where notifications can be sent through service workers by web content without direct user interaction. This could be used to open new tabs in a denial of service (DOS) attack or to display unwanted content from arbitrary URLs to users. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
